episodes.title: Andrew Lownie on the Downfall of Sarah Ferguson
episodes.description:
In this interview clip, Andrew Lownie discusses Fergie's Downfall and some of the revelations from his bestselling book 'Entitled: The Rise and Fall of House of York'.

00:00:00 Fergie’s childhood: parents, affairs & aristocratic attitudes
00:00:34 Abandonment issues, overeating, low self-esteem & debt
00:01:00 Major Ronald Ferguson: “Ginger Bush” & psychosexual dynamic
00:01:23 Promiscuity, acceptance of affairs & the “Jilly Cooper” aristocratic world
00:01:46 Early advice on scandal: “Hold your head up and be even more arrogant”
00:02:13 Miami photo scandal & chaotic flight home
00:02:40 Press humiliation, throwing peanuts, paper bags on head
00:03:01 Arrogance, entitlement & shameless survival strategy
00:03:29 Fergie & Andrew’s “thick skin” and surviving scandals
00:03:55 Arrested development: “I’m 59 but feel eight years old”
00:04:18 Andrew’s teddy bears, childish humour & slapstick courtship
00:04:49 Profiteroles, mock fights & juvenile behaviour
00:05:23 Fergie’s children’s YouTube channel & regression to childhood
00:05:46 Emotional immaturity & lack of responsibility
00:06:13 Lack of empathy & emotional development
00:06:33 Early marriage: the fairytale wedding & global popularity
00:06:56 Why the public saw them as a fresh start
00:07:10 “It’s a Royal Knockout” and first major PR collapse
00:07:34 Dignity vs relatability: where Fergie went wrong
00:07:57 Freebie holidays, imperiousness, weight & dress criticism
00:08:20 Budgie the Helicopter plagiarism & charity-book money issues
00:08:49 Selling access begins: Ronald Ferguson, dinners & Iraqi businessmen
00:09:18 Hello! Magazine deals & 30 years of monetised photo spreads
00:09:45 Paid dinners at Buckingham Palace: JP Morgan, Morgan Stanley
00:10:17 Palace facilities used for private benefit
00:10:42 Andrew’s mistress in the Royal Box & enabling network
00:11:10 Enablers from Queen to staff protecting the Yorks
00:11:32 Their marriage: two narcissists, both having affairs
00:11:52 Domestic rows, restraining Andrew at polo
00:12:14 Fergie upset at Andrew’s show-leave behaviour
00:12:36 Their reunion narrative: polls, PR, and cynicism
00:12:59 Fergie staying with Andrew to maintain status & income
00:13:28 Staff contempt: late-night meals after nights out
00:13:46 Multiple rices cooked & indecision
00:14:06 Ski lodge chaos, wasted food & wine
00:14:27 Summoning servants to open curtains
00:14:46 Fixing TVs at night & protection officers picking up golf balls
00:15:10 Obsession with titles: bowing, curtsying & protocol
00:15:30 Expected to call Andrew “sir” at Royal Lodge
00:15:50 Huge annual spending: £860,000 breakdown
00:16:13 Psychology: compulsive buying, hoarding, low self-worth
00:16:39 Endless Amazon boxes & hoarder behaviour
00:17:03 Charity work inconsistencies: money not reaching Romanian orphanages
00:17:30 Expenses eating charity income & blurred lines
00:17:50 Fergie’s personal gifts substituting for proper fundraising
00:18:08 When she genuinely helped: empathy with damaged children
00:18:36 Charitable potential overshadowed by greed & disorganisation
00:18:58 Charities used as fronts for social climbing
00:19:25 US charity also functioning as business HQ
00:19:47 How charity work subsidised her lifestyle
00:20:05 Celebrity obsessions: Costner, Tiger Woods, JFK Jr
00:20:28 Over-promising celebrity appearances to charity events
00:20:48 Everything transactional in Fergie’s world
00:21:10 Parenting Beatrice & Eugenie: performance vs reality
00:21:28 Public hand-holding vs nannies when cameras left
00:21:47 Andrew excluded while John Bryan played “dad” at Sunninghill
00:22:12 Children used as bargaining chips in divorce & Royal Lodge
00:22:40 Obsession with psychics: Madame Vasso
00:23:01 Diana & Andrew also drawn into psychic world
00:23:22 The “Charles will die, Andrew will be Regent” prophecy
00:23:45 Delusions, insecurity & need for magical thinking
00:24:08 Running the gates: temper, entitlement & destruction of property
00:24:26 From losing it to suddenly being sweetness and light
00:24:46 Andrew jabbing staff, throwing plates & Windsor temper
00:25:10 Prince Harry dispute & Windsor temperament
00:25:33 Cost to taxpayers when they smashed gates
00:25:58 They could have used another entrance
00:26:16 Stress vs professionalism: why royals must maintain control
00:26:37 Drugs question: Andrew & Fergie rumours
00:26:56 Alleged LA incidents, drinking, “Snow Castle” chalet
00:27:20 Why no allegations can be written without affidavits
00:27:42 Financial secrecy: companies, shell structures, missing audits
00:28:07 Pitch@Palace Global & lack of audited accounts
00:28:25 30–40 years of dormant companies obscuring money
00:28:50 Difficulty tracing income, gifts & benefactors
00:29:12 Suspicious financial arrangements & hidden wealth

episodes.title: Andrew Lownie on Andrew and Fergie's Marriage, Fiery Rows and Arrested Development
episodes.description:
Andrew Lownie reveals the extraordinary inner world of Sarah Ferguson and Prince Andrew — entitlement, chaos, spending, scandal, staff mistreatment, arrested development, and decades of behaviour that shaped the downfall of the Yorks. Including how Andrew cleared the Royal Box at the Royal Albert Hall for him and his mistress. 

From their volatile marriage to selling access, financial recklessness, and their strange 30-year post-divorce partnership. 

Andrew Lownie’s bestselling and explosive new book 'Entitled: The Rise and Fall of the House of York' is out now.

00:00:00 The early fairytale image of Andrew & Fergie
00:00:20 How the public mood shifted after It’s a Royal Knockout
00:00:39 Fergie’s vulgarity, foreign tours, and inappropriate comments

00:04:40 Press outcry and backtracking by the Palace

00:07:38 The cynical press-playing around “getting back together”
00:07:44 Running parallel affairs despite public narratives
00:08:02 Contempt for staff from the very start
00:08:08 Staff quarters bugged, NDAs, and court threats
00:08:29 Fergie’s transformation into an imperious boss
00:08:56 Lavish food waste, staff being overridden, chaos
00:09:22 Andrew’s rudeness, protocol obsession & police errands
00:09:49 His fixation on ceremony, titles, and pecking order
00:10:11 Entitlement masking insecurity
00:10:32 Misuse of staff and police; flight seat tantrums
00:10:47 Breakdown of Fergie’s massive annual expenditure
00:11:20 Shopping binges, indecision, and hoarding behaviour
00:11:45 Unopened Amazon boxes & childlike impulses
00:12:10 Buying affection, gifts, and validation
00:12:28 Fergie advising “be more arrogant” after scandal
00:12:49 Entitlement as a shield against shame
00:13:10 Miami flight meltdown & protective father
00:13:34 The “shameless” survival strategy
00:14:10 Arrested development: Fergie feeling “eight years old”
00:14:30 Andrew’s teddy bears & infantile humour
00:14:46 Slapstick pranks and childish games

00:16:23 How childhood wounds shaped their adult dysfunction

episodes.title: Andrew Lownie on Epstein's State Backing and Whether Andrew Mountbatten Windsor was Blackmailed
episodes.description:
Andrew Lownie, author of explosive new book 'Entitled: The Rise and Fall of the House of York' discusses whether Prince Andrew was blackmailed, his friendship with Donald Trump and how Jeffrey Epstein may have had state backing. 

Full interview here - https://youtu.be/9PJr_-EDCW8?si=9JICHnYIGw6gCLaZ

00:00:00 – Was Prince Andrew blackmailed?

00:01:16 – Palace officials and curt responses from the Queen
00:01:29 – Private Eye revelations and palace denial
00:01:52 – Queen’s blind spot and protection of Andrew
00:02:21 – Public gestures of support for Andrew

00:04:25 – Locker-room gossip and diplomat accounts

00:05:12 – Anecdotes about ironing boards and massages

00:08:50 – Epstein’s mysterious finances and Wexner’s role

00:09:57 – Networks of Maxwell, Epstein, Trump, Andrew
00:10:09 – State involvement: Saudi Arabia and Bezos blackmail comparison

00:11:08 – Epstein’s Middle Eastern intelligence ties

00:12:13 – Pressure on the UK government and monarchy

episodes.title: Andrew Lownie on the Rise and Fall of Fergie and Why Andrew Might End Up in Jail
episodes.description:
Andrew Lownie returns to 'Throwing the Book at Them' for his third in-depth interview about 'Entitled: The Rise and Fall of the House of York'.

Andrew gives us an exclusive new revelation and we spoke about everything that's happened since the book came out three months ago and then focused on Sarah Ferguson's stratospheric rise and fall and how her childhood might hold the key to her behaviour. 

00:00:00 Where the story stands now after the latest leaks
00:02:00 How the August interview set the stage; what changed since
00:04:00 The US leak pipeline and why timing matters
00:06:00 National-security angles around Andrew’s networks
00:08:00 Why Kazakhstan, Azerbaijan, Libya, China, and Ukraine recur
00:10:00 Mandelson–Epstein–Andrew overlap; Clinton questions
00:12:00 How “insurance files” and selective disclosure shape narratives
00:14:00 What the new material actually proves vs. suggests
00:16:00 Andrew’s commercial diplomacy pattern and opaque deals
00:18:00 What would be required to trigger formal legal action
00:20:00 The Royal Lodge moment and titles as narrative turning point
00:22:00 Fergie’s crisis strategy: distance, rebrand, survive
00:24:00 Alleged attempts to discredit Virginia Giuffre and PR lawfare
00:26:00 Why certain tabloids remain sympathetic; access journalism
00:28:00 Early-life aristocratic emotional imprint and abandonment themes
00:30:00 Courtship to marriage: intensity, narcissism, unraveling
00:32:00 Arrested development and refusal to mature
00:34:00 Money habits as identity, validation, and emotional coping
00:36:00 Reports of aggressive arguments and volatile episodes
00:38:00 Staff testimony: rudeness, protocol fixation, late-night demands
00:40:00 Freebies, foreign trips, “Knockout,” and slide into vulgarity
00:42:00 The £860k lifestyle economy: gifts, travel, wardrobes
00:44:00 Hoarding, excess buying, generosity as approval mechanism
00:46:00 Charity optics vs. actual outcomes
00:48:00 Parenting reality vs. public image
00:50:00 Sunninghill atmosphere, exclusion, and silent family distances
00:52:00 Gate-racing temper, smashed plates, Windsor anger patterns
00:54:00 Everything transactional: tickets, invites, introductions
00:56:00 Diana & Fergie: rivalry, leaks, reconciliation, fracture
00:58:00 Reputation management after 1997
01:00:00 Fergie & Epstein: logs, contact timeline, contradictions
01:02:00 The 2011 letter vs. later condemnations
01:04:00 Media choreography around interviews and PR containment
01:06:00 What Andrew and Fergie do now: private deals
01:08:00 What more could emerge
01:10:00 Political collateral: who remains protected and why
01:12:00 Titles as cash-flow: Beatrice and Eugenie’s branding value
01:14:00 Press relationships and how coverage is managed
01:16:00 Pattern of institutional containment until scandal breaks
01:18:00 What a real reckoning would require and what could move the needle next

episodes.title: Andrew Lownie on how the Palace Cover-up Prolonged the Abuse
episodes.description:
Andrew Lownie discusses the palace cover-up, how Andrew met Epstein and what he's found out since the release of his revelatory book 'Entitled: The Rise and Fall of the House of York'.

episodes.title: Andrew Lownie on Prince Andrew and the Queen's Moral Abdication
episodes.description:
I talked to Andrew Lownie about 'Entitled: The Rise and Fall of the House of York'. We covered Prince Andrew and Epstein, how the Queen knew there were concerns about his behaviour, and the stuff that he couldn't put in the book.
